definition: to draw/picture/painting/CL:幅[fu2],張|张[zhang1]/classifier for paintings etc/variant of 劃|划[hua4]
to mortgage/to pawn/to detain in custody/to escort and protect/(literary) to sign

sentences.english: A sign, such as a cross, made in lieu of a signature.
sentences.chinese: 画押，记号用来代替签名的标记，如十字符。

sentences.english: Season often focused on writing and playing fingerprints;
sentences.chinese: 季常思前想后，终画押和打手印。

sentences.english: Exams give money to a larger number of quality, have to own account on the signature or initialed.
sentences.chinese: 质举人举钱数目较大，还得自己在帐上签名或画押。

sentences.english: Their refusal to sign the contract has put us in a bind.
sentences.chinese: 工程师同总经理一起在承包合同上签字画押。

sentences.english: No employer had stamped them during the past three days.
sentences.chinese: 在过去的三天内没有老板在上面签字画押。

sentences.english: The engineers and the manager-in-chief signed or made their marks together on the contract.
sentences.chinese: 工程师同总经理一起在承包合同上签字画押。
他已在口供上签字画押。

definition: signature (in grass-style writing)/symbol used in place of a signature (on a document, contract etc)
to bind over (as surety)/to sign an undertaking
oral confession (as opposed to 筆供|笔供[bi3 gong4])/statement/deposition
